instruction: What does RIS stand for?
output: RIS is the Research Infrastructure Services team within WashU IT.

instruction: Can you tell me about RIS?
output: RIS is the Research Infrastructure Services team within WashU IT.

instruction: Tell me what RIS is.
output: RIS is the Research Infrastructure Services team within WashU IT.

instruction: What does RIS mean?
output: RIS is the Research Infrastructure Services team within WashU IT.

instruction: Can you define what RIS is?
output: RIS is the Research Infrastructure Services team within WashU IT.

instruction: Who are RIS Services for?
output: RIS services are for WashU faculty and staff, focused on the research mission of WashU.

instruction: Where can I get help with WUSTL Keys?
output: https://it.wustl.edu/home/how-to/wustl-connect/

instruction: What is the RIS computing services datacenter physical address?
output: 222 S Newstead Ave. St. Louis, MO 63110

instruction: How do I get help with the RIS Compute Service?
output: The RIS Service Desk has a section for the Compute Service.

instruction: Where can I find RIS Compute Documentation?
output: The RIS User Manual has a chapter for the Compute Service.

instruction: How do I contact RIS?
output: RIS uses the RIS Service Desk to interact with users. Each category of the Service Desk includes an “Ask a question” related to that service.

instruction: Where can I find the RIS User Manual?
output: The RIS User Manual can be found here: https://docs.ris.wustl.edu/index.html

instruction: How do I make it so I can log in to RIS compute without having to use my password?
output: We suggest you make use of SSH keys to log into the compute clients, see SSH Key-Pair Setup.

instruction: Give me some resources for docker.
output: Check out our docker workshop here: https://docs.ris.wustl.edu/doc/compute/workshops/ris-docker-workshop.html

instruction: Where can I find RIS-Vetted Application Containers?
output: Check out this page: https://docs.ris.wustl.edu/doc/compute/recipes/ris-vetted-compute-apps.html

instruction: Show me where to find RIS-Supported Application Containers?
output: You can find a list of RIS-Supported Application Containers here: https://docs.ris.wustl.edu/doc/compute/recipes/ris-supported-containers.html

instruction: Tell me about File Naming Best Practices
output: File names should be precise as NTFS file name size has a limit of 255 characters. This is a hard limit of the system that the Storage/Compute platform uses. Any files to be transferred to Storage/Compute need to be created following this limit or they cannot be transferred.

instruction: Is there a GUI based system for using the RIS Scientific Compute Platforms?
output: Yes, check out our guide on Open On Demand, a GUI based system for using the Scientific Compute Platforms: https://docs.ris.wustl.edu/doc/compute/compute-ood.html
